articles.title: IIT-M makes low-cost solar power tech for areas with less space
articles.description: Chennai: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras (IIT-M) developed a low-cost solar power technology that can improve energy access .
articles.content: Chennai: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras (IIT-M) developed a low-cost solar power technology that can improve energy access in rural regions and in urban areas with space constraints. The work, described as a ‘people-first' ... [2487 chars]

articles.title: India secures exclusive international rights for Indian Ocean exploration: Dr Jitendra
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Sept 20 : Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Earth Sciences; Science & Technology, MoS PMO Dr. Jitendra Singh announced the signing of a new 15-year contract between the Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) and the “International Seabed Authority” (ISA) for exclusive rights to explore Polymetallic Sulphides (PMS) in the allotted 10,000 sq km area of the Carlsberg Ridge in the Indian Ocean. The MoU was signed in the presence of Secretary General “International Seabed […]

articles.description: Microsoft celebrates fifteen years in Ireland as the country continues to attract international technology companies.

articles.title: New battery promises almost 500km of range with 10-minute charge
articles.description: China’s battery giant CATL is aggressively chasing the European EV industry, with its latest battery offering cutting-edge charging and safety technology.
articles.content:
The world’s largest battery maker is targeting the European electric vehicle (EV) market with a new battery promising 478km of range with just 10 minutes of super-fast charging – an improvement on figures originally quoted back in August 2023.
Chines... [1913 chars]

articles.title: Scottish regiment forms first drone platoon as soldiers train on latest systems
articles.description: The army’s Scottish line infantry regiment has formed its first dedicated drone platoon, with soldiers getting to grips with the latest reconnaissance technology.
articles.content:
Soldiers from Second Battalion, the Royal Regiment of Scotland – known as 2 Scots – recently carried out training with the army’s latest reconnaissance drones at Dreghorn Barracks in Edinburgh.
The battalion established its first remotely-piloted air... [2176 chars]

articles.title: This UFO Survived A Hellfire Missile And No One Knows How
articles.description: The Pentagon can’t explain how a UAP withstood a Hellfire missile. Lawmakers and scientists now face a puzzle that challenges current technology.
articles.content: UFOs are real. Alright, we're not talking about the X-Files or little green men or even Area 51. The modern term for UFO, which in itself merely stands for unidentified flying object, is unidentified anomalous phenomena, or UAP. UAPs are defined as a... [2435 chars]

articles.title: AI's super brain scoops up the crims
articles.description: The Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) has launched an advanced surveillance system using artificial intelligence (AI) to identify and apprehend criminals quickly and accurately. Pol Maj Gen Sarut Kwaengsopha, CIB Deputy Commissioner, said technology once seen as science fiction is now a powerful tool for public safety.
articles.content: The Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) has launched an advanced surveillance system using artificial intelligence (AI) to identify and apprehend criminals quickly and accurately. Pol Maj Gen Sarut Kwaengsopha, CIB Deputy Commissioner, said technology... [4460 chars]

articles.title: Indrakeeladri ready for Dasara rush with AI surveillance and sector-wise planning
articles.description: Vijayawada: Preparations for the grand Vijayawada Dasara Mahotsavam are nearing completion, with a special focus on technology-driven crowd management.
articles.content: Vijayawada: Preparations for the grand Vijayawada Dasara Mahotsavam are nearing completion, with a special focus on technology-driven crowd management. Authorities have announced that queue lines at Indrakeeladri will be continuously monitored using ... [1827 chars]
